content.question: Which of the following geologic profiles would most likely be found at the circled region in the figure?

choices.label: The figure presents a layer of disconformity, consisting of metamorphic rock to the left of igneous rock.

The figure presents four layers of the Earth. Beginning at the bottom and moving upward, the layers of Earth are: Igneous Rock, Sedimentary Rock, Peat with fossilized plants, and Peat with fossilized leaves.
The figure presents four layers of the Earth. Beginning at the bottom and moving upward, the layers of Earth are: igneous rock, silt, sandstone with fossilized shells, and clay.

The figure presents 4 layers of the Earth. Beginning at the bottom and moving upwards, the first three layers demonstrate angular unconformity and consist of igneous rock, magma, and igneous rock. The top layer consists of sedimentary rock.

content.answer: The figure presents four layers of the Earth. Beginning at the bottom and moving upward, the layers of Earth are: Igneous Rock, Sedimentary Rock, Peat with fossilized plants, and Peat with fossilized leaves.

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Explain relationships between different characteristics of environmental concepts, processes, or models represented visually. a. In theoretical contexts. b. In applied contexts.
